required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of FCN-338 in Patients With Chronic CLL/SLL
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Trial to Evaluate the Tolerability、Pharmacokinetics and Preliminary Antitumor Activity of FCN-338 in Patients With CLL/SLL

brief_summary.textblock: This study is being done to evaluate the Tolerability、Pharmacokinetics and Preliminary antitumor activity of oral FCN-338 for the treatment of patients with chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) or small lymphocytic lymphoma (SLL), who have failed or are intolerant to one or more lines of established therapy or for whom no other treatment options are available.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a multicenter, open-label, Phase I dose escalation study of Tolerability、Pharmacokinetics and Preliminary antitumor activity of FCN-338 in ascending cohorts to determine the MTD or recommended dose in patients with relapsed or refractory CLL/SLL patients. This is to be followed by a cohort expansion phase at the MTD or recommended oral dose.

primary_outcome.measure: The occurrence of treatment-related adverse events meeting the criteria for dose limiting toxicities (DLTs)
To establish the recommended MTD dose and Phase 2 dose (RP2D) of FCN-338 for future clinical trials in patients with advanced CLL/SLL
The occurrence of adverse events (AEs) reported in all subjects who received study drug
primary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment up to 30 days after last dose

primary_outcome.measure: The occurrence of treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose up to 30 days after last dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic variables including maximum plasma concentration (Cmax)
Pharmacokinetic variables including minimum plasma concentration (Cmin)
To quantify the last time point with a quantifiable concentration (AUClast) of FCN-338
To measure the time to reach the highest plasma concentrations (Tmax) of FCN-338
To quantify the terminal half-life (T1/2) of FCN-338 after administration as a single agent
To quantify the plasma clearance (CL/f) of FCN-338 after administration as a single agent
To determine the best overall response rate (ORR) by Response Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) v1.1 in subjects with Chronic CLL/SLL
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured up to 2 years after the last participant has enrolled in the study

arm_group.description: FCN-338 will be given orally in ascending doses in patients with relapsed or refractory CLL/SLL , until the maximum tolerated dose or recommended dose is reached. Followed by up to 43 patients enrolled in the expansion cohort at the recommended dose.

intervention.description: FCN-338 will be given orally in ascending doses starting at 50 mg QD until the maximum tolerated dose or recommended dose is reached.
